intro: Stegostyla angustata, commonly known as the narrow-leaf stegostyla, is a species of flowering plant in the family Araliaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa, particularly in countries such as Kenya and Tanzania. The plant is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, alternate leaves that are typically narrow and elliptical in shape. Its flowers are clustered in umbels and are usually white or pale green, contributing to its ornamental appeal. Stegostyla angustata is often grown as a houseplant due to its attractive foliage and relatively low maintenance requirements.
